quote.msg: 發生咩事

https://github.com/git-for-windows/git/issues/2674
自己追post

你可否簡述之？
唔得閒追
謝

replies.msg:
ok

1. maintainer 開個issue話要轉用 "inclusive-naming", 將 master變做其他字眼如 main/default, 原因：
- "master" 呢隻字有 master <-> slave 既 connotation，會令black people有 hard feeling
2. 其他devs開始comment反對：
- 個change會breaks existing tooling/ build system/ CI
- 另外多數comments就係話個change係 冇鳩用 next to nothing
- 冇人會將git上面 master branch既 master聯想起master <-> slave，話有呢個諗法既人本身加racist
- blahblahblah
3. maintainer 回覆類似：
- 話呢個change已經有 consensus，話有多數人認同之類 (e.g. from mailing list & some tweet posts)
- 話個 issue入面既 commenters and devs 唔係 "representative"
- 拎個 repo 既 code of conduct出黎話要remove d comments
4. 之後愈黎愈多人留言，多數反對（之後入去睇）
5. 最尾就好似張圖咁，block人 + mark d comments as disruptive / minimized, etc.

Words have more than one meaning. It's meaning depends on the context.

"Master document" is the original of a document, to tell it apart from copies. It doesn't mean it's copies are slaves.
"Master Yoda" means he's skilled and has an apprentice. Obi-wan Kenobi was not his slave.
